title: To comment or not to comment? That's the question!!!!
text:
I am of two minds when it comes to News24's new comment proposal. I used to be very active on News24, writing articles or letters and commenting on a wide range of subjects from Rugby to Politics.
I started noticing fake accounts start creeping in owned by trolls who were hell bent on ruining the comment sections of News24. If I remember correctly it started in the rugby section.
We used to have fantastic well thought out debates about all rugby that was current and a small group of fake accounts absolutely ruined it for everyone, so I stopped commenting.
Then the same thing started happening on the news site with political stories being hi-jacked by party trolls. So I stopped commenting there.
The fact is I used to be very active and loved the comments section, now I hardly use news24 because of how bad the comments section is this leaves me with a dilemma! Comments are vitally important, we want to know what people think and I would probably still stay away from News24 without comments.
I think your challenge is not to stop comments but to create a more secure comment section with users needed to sign up as members. With consequences for actions.
I am sure most of the trolls would disappear with more stringent rules in place.
